revised_title: Unsteady Boundary Layer Due to Rectilinear Vortex
tldr: The article investigates the unsteady boundary layer created by the motion of a single rectilinear vortex filament above an infinite plane wall. It concludes that the boundary-layer flow is inherently unsteady for all time and explores the nature of this unsteady flow. The theory is compared with experiments on the flow induced near the ground by trailing aircraft vortices, showing a favorable agreement.
